description: Borrowed from French gendarme, from plural gendarmes, a re-spelling of gens d'armes (“people of arms", "armed people”).

entries.meaning: A member of the gendarmerie, a military body charged with police duties.

examples: The US is tempted to play the role of global gendarme because everyone knows that the UN, as it is, lacks the resources and capacity to fill this role.

entries.meaning: A rock pinnacle on a mountain ridge.
